topic: In countries with diverse religious populations, should government institutions officially promote or favor one particular religion over others?

initial_response.Orthodox_Europe: In my view, the separation of church and state is crucial for fostering a truly democratic and inclusive environment. By not favoring any particular religion, governments can better serve the diverse needs of their populations and uphold the values of tolerance and pluralism. This approach not only strengthens social bonds but also enhances the credibility and effectiveness of governmental institutions.
